etymologies: Middle English (earlier as sawer): from the noun saw+ -yer

definitions: a person who saws timber for a living.
shortDefinitions: person who saws timber for living

definitions: an uprooted tree floating in a river but held fast at one end.
etymologies: with allusion to the trapped log's movement backwards and forwards
shortDefinitions: uprooted tree floating in river but held fast at one end

definitions: a large longhorn beetle whose larvae bore tunnels in the wood of injured or recently felled trees, producing an audible chewing sound.
shortDefinitions: large longhorn beetle whose larvae bore tunnels in wood of injured or recently felled trees
